item.title: Using Kicksecure XFCE VM as offline Cold Storage
item.dc:creator: @Patrick
item.description:
Documented just now:

Kicksecure – 28 Oct 22

Offline Mode

Using Kicksecure ™ offline for example for vault VMs.

item.title: Systemcheck wont load/work on debian 12 (next release)
item.dc:creator: @Patrick
item.description:
Also solved by this?

Add pyqt5-dev-tool dependency to kicksecure dependencies Development
Root cause is that meta package kicksecure-desktop-applications-recommended isn’t installed. That package would ensure that the dependency package repository-dist-wizard gets installed. I’ve updated the installation instructions just now: Here’s the change: Debian: Difference between revisions - Kicksecure

item.title: Clean Installing KS On Debian 11 CLI, Hit Security Misc Error
item.dc:creator: @Patrick
item.description:
ike:

Is there no way to ditch sudo completely?

No, there’s not.

ike:

I have a setup where root can only login via recovery boot, and non-root users cannot get privileges. No sudo, no su. ‘passwd -l root’. Can I use this setup with kicksecure?

No, not without development effort.

Related, the long term Kicksecure development roadmap.

The long term concept:

Kicksecure – 28 Oct 22

Multiple Boot Modes for Better Security: an Implementation of Untrusted Root

Persistent User / Live user / Persistent Secureadmin / Persistent Superadmin / Persistent Recovery Mode

Whonix Forum – 6 May 20

multiple boot modes for better security: persistent user | live user |...

One thing hasn’t been considered yet at all: server support. grub boot menu isn’t easily accessible for many/most servers. How would these various boot modes be available for servers? Live mode: that probably makes little sense on servers. ...

sudoless is not coming anytime soon. Might be years if not decades. Unless there are volunteer contributors.

item.title: Clean Installing KS On Debian 11 CLI, Hit Security Misc Error
item.dc:creator: @ike
item.description: Is there no way to ditch sudo completely? I have a setup where root can only login via recovery boot, and non-root users cannot get privileges. No sudo, no su. ‘passwd -l root’. Can I use this setup with kicksecure?

Also solved by this?

Add pyqt5-dev-tool dependency to kicksecure dependencies Development
Root cause is that meta package kicksecure-desktop-applications-recommended isn’t installed. That package would ensure that the dependency package repository-dist-wizard gets installed. I’ve updated the installation instructions just now: Here’s the change: Debian: Difference between revisions - Kicksecure

item.title: Add pyqt5-dev-tool dependency to kicksecure dependencies
item.dc:creator: @Patrick
item.description:
Root cause is that meta package kicksecure-desktop-applications-recommended isn’t installed.

That package would ensure that the dependency package repository-dist-wizard gets installed.

I’ve updated the installation instructions just now:

Kicksecure – 28 Oct 22

Install Kicksecure ™ inside Debian

Kicksecure ™ can be installed on top of an existing Debian installation.

Here’s the change:

Debian: Difference between revisions - Kicksecure

item.title: Changing kicksecure repository to tester will add tor+ by default to the repo
item.dc:creator: @Patrick
item.description:
Added a note in the wiki to document this:

Template:Project-APT-Repository-Add: Difference between revisions - Kicksecure

item.title: Disable unnecessary startup processes e.g evolution calendar
item.dc:creator: @Patrick
item.description:
One option to solve this could be by moving away from gdm. Related discussion:

Whonix Forum – 27 Sep 21

display manager - lightdm, gdm3, sddm or no display manager (startx)

Whonix 15 was using lightdm. It was removed due to autologin heisenbug. [1] [2] [3] Therefore Whonix 16 is using gdm3. It is also a good choice because it supports wayland (and fits with Gnome, which Whonix might be ported to, depending on many...

Reading time: 1 mins 🕑 Likes: 8 ❤

item.title: Installing OpenVPN Client: Permission Denied
item.dc:creator: @Patrick
item.description:
This is unspecific to Kicksecure.

Kicksecure – 17 Sep 22

Information Booster might be Available!

Utilizing other resources to help solve questions/issues unspecific to Kicksecure ™.

The same issue would happen on Debian or most other Linux distribution. This would be a case for https://www.kicksecure.com/wiki/Free_Support_Principle

(bold added, space added)

See the > in your post.

mh4speech:

user@localhost:/etc/openvpn$ sudo curl -fsSL https://swupdate.openvpn.net/community/openvpn3/repos/openvpn3-$DISTRO.list > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/openvpn3.list

That cannot work. “>” is a shell redirection and as the current user. sudo doesn’t work for shell redirection. But the current user “user” does not have permissions to write into /etc.

So these instructions are simply wrong.

Options:

  • A) Try replace > with | sudo tee, OR
  • B) Become root first using sudo su.

Also these instructions lack instructions to verify that signing key but that’s a difficult topic. See:

Kicksecure – 9 Aug 22

Verifying Software Signatures

Digital signatures can increase security but this requires knowledge. Learn more about Verifying Software Signatures, What Digital Signatures (Not) Prove, Verification Security Levels, Conceptual Challenges, Attacks in the Wild.

item.title: Clean Installing KS On Debian 11 CLI, Hit Security Misc Error
item.dc:creator: @Patrick
item.description: Thanks. Footnote has been improved just now.

item.title: Systemcheck wont load/work on debian 12 (next release)
item.dc:creator: @nurmagoz
item.description:
Tested installing kicksecure-gui in debian stable 11 then upgraded to 12 then check systemcheck if it will run i got this message:

sudo: error while loading shared libraries: libsudo_util.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

item.title: Add pyqt5-dev-tool dependency to kicksecure dependencies
item.dc:creator: @nurmagoz
item.description: Installing kicksecure-gui on debian fresh .iso will render repository-dist-wizard dysfunctional due to missing dependency pyqt5-dev-tool

item.title: Not having a default browser and pressing on "Web Browoser" icon in xfce will give annoying bug
item.dc:creator: @nurmagoz
item.description:
Since we dont have a default browser by default so any user who is morphing debian fresh install he will not have a browser as well (specially debian minimal version like netinst or CD…etc).

This will give annoying show annoying bug:

Will show a bug window which you need to press on OK multiple times to disappear:

1

2

3

4

5

item.title: Changing kicksecure repository to tester will add tor+ by default to the repo
item.dc:creator: @nurmagoz
item.description: If i have set kicksecure repo to be over clearnet using only https and then i switched the repository to tester using repository-dist-wizard it will add tor+ to the repository which is disrespecting user preferences if he choose C: Clearnet Rep.

item.title: Disable unnecessary startup processes e.g evolution calendar
item.dc:creator: @nurmagoz
item.description: Due to gdm dependencies it come with too wide gnome tools which arent useful to have as a default, but if there is no way around except if we have them then its better to have them disabled by default as this will drain extra resources for nothing e.g Evolution Alarm Notify: (there is even no evolution by default)

item.title: Installing OpenVPN Client: Permission Denied
item.dc:creator: @mh4speech
item.description:
Hello! I’m still new to KickSecure but I’m running it inside a VM so that I can use VPN at a public library, pretty awesome. Trying to install the nice OpenVPN GUI and I’m getting permission denied for adding their key or modifying sources.list and I just don’t know why permission is denied. What can I do?

Terminal Output:

user@localhost:/etc/openvpn$ sudo curl -fsSL https://swupdate.openvpn.net/repos/openvpn-repo-pkg-key.pub | gpg --dearmor > /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/openvpn-repo-pkg-keyring.gpg
bash: /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/openvpn-repo-pkg-keyring.gpg: Permission denied
(23) Failed writing body
user@localhost:/etc/openvpn$ sudo curl -fsSL https://swupdate.openvpn.net/community/openvpn3/repos/openvpn3-$DISTRO.list >/etc/apt/sources.list.d/openvpn3.list
bash: /etc/apt/sources.list.d/openvpn3.list: Permission denied
user@localhost:/etc/openvpn$

Trying to follow this guilde:
https://community.openvpn.net/openvpn/wiki/OpenVPN3Linux?_ga=2.125702925.623086276.1666733252-1528184479.1666733232&_gl=11mn6wlq_gaMTUyODE4NDQ3OS4xNjY2NzMzMjMy_ga_SPGM8Y8Y79*MTY2NjczMzIzMy4xLjEuMTY2NjczMzMyMi4wLjAuMA…

item.title: Intel Tiger Lake SOF Sound Driver
item.dc:creator: @mh4speech
item.description:
Thanks for the response.

It was 1.8 inside the folder, but nowhere in the ReadMe could I get the right version. Neither was the version online. I just had to go in the folder of what would not install.

It worked, thanks!

item.title: Clean Installing KS On Debian 11 CLI, Hit Security Misc Error
item.dc:creator: @L0phtyDreams
item.description:
I thought it said in the footnotes tfor not putting the user in the sudoer group that you could still do the morph without putting a user in. I will modify my approach and try it again.

From Footnote 4:

" The following command /usr/sbin/adduser user sudo grants root rights to user user. If the user intents to use user user without root rights for better security, the user should omit running the /usr/sbin/adduser user sudo and instead, in case of:

  • Debian: Use su."

Thanks for the quick responses.

item.title: Clean Installing KS On Debian 11 CLI, Hit Security Misc Error
item.dc:creator: @ike
item.description:
I hit the same sudo issue. This is a source of confusion, perhaps:

Kicksecure – 16 Aug 22

Install Kicksecure ™ inside Debian

Kicksecure ™ can be installed on top of an existing Debian installation.

item.title: Clean Installing KS On Debian 11 CLI, Hit Security Misc Error
item.dc:creator: @Woman-at-arms
item.description: Did you follow the instructions for adding a user to the sudoers group? It’s part of the documented conversion process. Just making sure.

item.title: Clean Installing KS On Debian 11 CLI, Hit Security Misc Error
item.dc:creator: @Patrick
item.description:
Some user need to be a member of the linux user group sudo. Not
necessarily user user.

item.title: Clean Installing KS On Debian 11 CLI, Hit Security Misc Error
item.dc:creator: @L0phtyDreams
item.description:
I was going through all the steps to morph Debian 11 to KS and hit a snag at the very last part. While running “sudo apt install kicksecure-xfce” it hits an error "/var/lib/dpkg/tmp.ci/preinst: ERROR: No user is a member of group ‘sudo’. Installation aborted.

I followed the guidance for not making user sudo due to a preference to keep root the only admin account.

Is it possible to use the xfce installer without having user in sudo?

item.title: Using Kicksecure XFCE VM as offline Cold Storage
item.dc:creator: @hotcapy
item.description:
Hello, dear users and developers!

I have a question. Is it possible/wise/endorsed-by-developers to use Kicksecure XFCE OS in VirtualBox as completely offline virtual machine for cold storage? If the answer is “yes”, then how to properly configure both virtual machine and Kicksecure settings for that purpose?

Is it enough to just disable network in VirtualBox settings for Kicksecure?
Or should I also disable such things as System Check and sdwdate inside Kicksecure somehow since there is no internet connection anyway? Which time should I set in such case to be secure?

Thank you very much for your work on Whonix, and for your answer in advance too!

item.title: Problem with hardended_malloc
item.dc:creator: @Patrick
item.description:
Thanks for the report!

If you like this bug fixed, you would need to report this against upstream. → https://www.x.org

A feature request similar to this

https://bugzilla.mindrot.org/show_bug.cgi?id=3245

would be helpful and might avoid this issue if upstream implements it.

related:
https://www.kicksecure.com/wiki/Hardened_Malloc#Graphical_Desktop_Environment_Xorg

item.title: Problem with hardended_malloc
item.dc:creator: @evelyn.flick
item.description:
Problem with hardended_malloc

Installed packages kicksecure-xfce and hardened malloc following instructions from website, original system is debian stable, kernel from backports.

When using hardened malloc light does not start xorg, throws in CLI. Logs attached. When I run ld-system-preload-disable startx from the CLI, xorg works. It also works if I remove the hardened malloc light. What to do?
